<item>
	<title>Moisturize skin twice a day and winter itch disappears</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/health_wellness/opinion/2018/02/12/moisturize-skin-twice-a-day-and-winter-itch-disappears.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">0ebde78e-c829-4e3e-88b1-da5634292880</guid>
	<author>Dr. Vincent Piguet - University of Toronto</author>
	<pubDate>Mon, 12 Feb 2018 11:00:00 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/opinion/2018/02/12/moisturize-skin-twice-a-day-and-winter-itch-disappears/moms_tips_itchy_skin_mct.jpg"/><br/>Cold dehydrates the skin, which is the first barrier of protection against the environment, allowing irritants and allergens to get in. </description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/opinion/2018/02/12/moisturize-skin-twice-a-day-and-winter-itch-disappears/moms_tips_itchy_skin_mct.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Moisturize skin twice a day and winter itch disappears</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/opinion/2018/02/12/moisturize-skin-twice-a-day-and-winter-itch-disappears/moms_tips_itchy_skin_mct.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Moisturizing is the key to fixing dry, itchy skin problems, big and small. If you have winter itch caused by the cold, Dr. Vincent Piquet recommends moisturizing all of your skin with a thick cream or ointment, twice a day, every day.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Dreamstime</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner"></media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Find balance and strength in Downward Duck </title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/02/12/find-balance-and-strength-in-downward-duck.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">136e2dd2-466d-4c65-9a14-78642fc5a6d2</guid>
	<author>YuMee Chung - Special to the Star</author>
	<pubDate>Mon, 12 Feb 2018 06:00:00 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/02/12/find-balance-and-strength-in-downward-duck/downward_duck.jpg"/><br/>This challenging pose improves coordination, stretches the backside and strengthens the legs.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/02/12/find-balance-and-strength-in-downward-duck/downward_duck.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Find balance and strength in Downward Duck </media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/02/12/find-balance-and-strength-in-downward-duck/downward_duck.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>YuMee Chung demonstrates Downward Duck Pose at the Bentway Skate Trail, 250 Fort York Blvd., in Toronto.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Anne-Marie Jackson</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Toronto Star</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Hypochondriacs’ worst fears are a Google search away</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/health_wellness/2018/02/10/hypochondriacs-worst-fears-are-a-google-search-away.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">743842d6-a91a-408a-98ef-7618129b0186</guid>
	<author>Emily Sohn - The Washington Post</author>
	<pubDate>Sat, 10 Feb 2018 11:00:00 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/02/10/hypochondriacs-worst-fears-are-a-google-search-away/anxiety.jpg"/><br/>The anxiety that comes with health issues can prompt people to get needed treatment, but the anxiety can become its own problem.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/02/10/hypochondriacs-worst-fears-are-a-google-search-away/anxiety.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Hypochondriacs’ worst fears are a Google search away</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/02/10/hypochondriacs-worst-fears-are-a-google-search-away/anxiety.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>The internet has become a potential breeding ground for health anxiety, according to researchers who use the term “cyberchondria” to describe the interplay between online health searches and health anxiety.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">dreamstime photo</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>When you should visit your doctor about headaches</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/02/05/when-you-should-visit-your-doctor-about-headaches.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">002c3c51-5a50-42e3-9b40-51d97aa03931</guid>
	<author>Jill U. Adams - The Washington Post</author>
	<pubDate>Mon, 5 Feb 2018 11:00:00 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/02/05/when-you-should-visit-your-doctor-about-headaches/headache.jpg"/><br/>Headaches are often innocuous, but they can sometimes be symptomatic of more-serious conditions.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/02/05/when-you-should-visit-your-doctor-about-headaches/headache.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>When you should visit your doctor about headaches</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/02/05/when-you-should-visit-your-doctor-about-headaches/headache.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>One physician advises visiting your doctor if the rule of twos applies: more than two headaches a week for more than two weeks.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Dreamstime</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>How to kick a sugar addiction for good</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/02/05/how-to-kick-a-sugar-addiction-for-good.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">234955e7-e33f-4320-bc71-3e92d262f88b</guid>
	<author>Casey Seidenberg - The Washington Post</author>
	<pubDate>Mon, 5 Feb 2018 11:00:00 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/02/05/how-to-kick-a-sugar-addiction-for-good/sugar.jpg"/><br/>Sugar has been shown to have an effect on the brain similar to that of an addictive drug. Quickly removing it from your diet can cause withdrawal symptoms, including fatigue, depression and headaches. </description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/02/05/how-to-kick-a-sugar-addiction-for-good/sugar.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>How to kick a sugar addiction for good</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/02/05/how-to-kick-a-sugar-addiction-for-good/sugar.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Some cravings emanate not from your belly, but from your brain, as a result of lifestyle.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">DUSTIN CHAMBERS</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">The New York Times</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Teach your old Downward Facing Dog a new trick</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/02/05/speed-skating-dog.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">558dd271-1010-454f-afd1-57aba7d58b51</guid>
	<author>YuMee Chung - Special to the Star</author>
	<pubDate>Mon, 5 Feb 2018 06:00:00 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/02/05/speed-skating-dog/speed_skating_dog.jpg"/><br/>Speed Skating Dog is a whimsical pose that breathes new life into the yoga classic, Downward Facing Dog Pose. </description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/02/05/speed-skating-dog/speed_skating_dog.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Teach your old Downward Facing Dog a new trick</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/02/05/speed-skating-dog/speed_skating_dog.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>YuMee Chung demonstrates Speed Skating Dog Pose at the Bentway Skate Trail.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Anne-Marie Jackson</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Toronto Star</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Plastic surgeons sharing procedures on social media raises ethical concerns</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/health_wellness/2018/02/04/plastic-surgeons-sharing-procedures-on-social-media-raises-ethical-concerns.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">63d52df4-213d-43a1-9810-660c6d6f0b59</guid>
	<author>Azzura Lalani - Staff Reporter</author>
	<pubDate>Sun, 4 Feb 2018 17:00:00 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/02/04/plastic-surgeons-sharing-procedures-on-social-media-raises-ethical-concerns/front_martin_jugenburg.jpg"/><br/>Critics are concerned that viewers and potential patients may not be getting a full picture of the risks involved.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/02/04/plastic-surgeons-sharing-procedures-on-social-media-raises-ethical-concerns/front_martin_jugenburg.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Plastic surgeons sharing procedures on social media raises ethical concerns</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/02/04/plastic-surgeons-sharing-procedures-on-social-media-raises-ethical-concerns/front_martin_jugenburg.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Toronto plastic surgeon Dr. Martin Jugenburg shares videos and photos of liposuction, breast augmentations and the increasingly popular Brazilian butt lifts in grisly detail on his Instagram and Snapchat accounts.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Carlos Osorio</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Toronto Star</media:credit>
</media:content><media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/02/04/plastic-surgeons-sharing-procedures-on-social-media-raises-ethical-concerns/inside_martin_jugenburg.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Plastic surgeons sharing procedures on social media raises ethical concerns</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/02/04/plastic-surgeons-sharing-procedures-on-social-media-raises-ethical-concerns/inside_martin_jugenburg.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Dr. Martin Jugenburg says he is providing an educational tool, but critics worry online postings could easily cross ethical lines.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Carlos Osorio</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Toronto Star</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Overtraining syndrome can hamper amateur athletes</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/health_wellness/2018/01/29/overtraining-syndrome-can-hamper-amateur-athletes.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">258d6076-b5ea-4ca2-9c91-eee393acfe40</guid>
	<author>Gabriella Boston - The Washington Post</author>
	<pubDate>Mon, 29 Jan 2018 11:00:00 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/01/29/overtraining-syndrome-can-hamper-amateur-athletes/angry_exercise.jpg"/><br/>Sleep disturbances, lack of motivation and moodiness all possible warning signs of overtraining syndrome.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/01/29/overtraining-syndrome-can-hamper-amateur-athletes/angry_exercise.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Overtraining syndrome can hamper amateur athletes</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/01/29/overtraining-syndrome-can-hamper-amateur-athletes/angry_exercise.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>When exercise brings on feelings of depression, injuries or a lack of motivation, it may be a case of overtraining syndrome.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Dreamstime</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Four arm workouts to do without weights</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/health_wellness/2018/01/29/four-arm-workouts-to-do-without-weights.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">ab00c5b9-4333-4bf0-ab25-f6d6777d4345</guid>
	<author>Erin Jahns - Byrdie</author>
	<pubDate>Mon, 29 Jan 2018 11:00:00 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/01/29/four-arm-workouts-to-do-without-weights/shadowboxing.jpg"/><br/>Help sculpt and shape your arms using these effective techniques from four top fitness experts.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/01/29/four-arm-workouts-to-do-without-weights/shadowboxing.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Four arm workouts to do without weights</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/01/29/four-arm-workouts-to-do-without-weights/shadowboxing.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Shadowboxing is a major calorie burner that helps improve technique and co-ordination.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Dreamstime</media:credit>
</media:content><media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/01/29/four-arm-workouts-to-do-without-weights/arm_circles.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Four arm workouts to do without weights</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/01/29/four-arm-workouts-to-do-without-weights/arm_circles.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Standing arm circles are a user-friendly work out perfect for when you're on the go or running short on time.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Dreamstime</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Do the Alley-Oop</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/01/29/do-the-alley-oop.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">3b8c5cbb-4cef-40b3-b8a0-4fea19e257b8</guid>
	<author>YuMee Chung - Special to the Star</author>
	<pubDate>Mon, 29 Jan 2018 06:00:00 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/01/29/do-the-alley-oop/alley_oop.jpg"/><br/>This move will help limber up your spine, liberate your shoulders and improve athletic performance. </description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/01/29/do-the-alley-oop/alley_oop.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Do the Alley-Oop</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/01/29/do-the-alley-oop/alley_oop.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>YuMee Chung's Ally-Oop stretch increases mobility for the spine, as well as improves athletic performance.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Anne-Marie Jackson</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Toronto Star</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Study shows the flu can trigger a heart attack in older adults </title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/health_wellness/2018/01/25/study-shows-the-flu-can-trigger-a-heart-attack-in-older-adults.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">8fc547d3-8b39-4e5a-aabd-fb9e277d6d56</guid>
	<author>Isabel Teotonio - Life Reporter</author>
	<pubDate>Thu, 25 Jan 2018 13:23:14 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/01/25/study-shows-the-flu-can-trigger-a-heart-attack-in-older-adults/authorofstudy.jpg"/><br/>Study by Ontario researchers says the flu can trigger a heart attack, reinforcing the importance of getting vaccinated.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/01/25/study-shows-the-flu-can-trigger-a-heart-attack-in-older-adults/authorofstudy.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Study shows the flu can trigger a heart attack in older adults </media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/01/25/study-shows-the-flu-can-trigger-a-heart-attack-in-older-adults/authorofstudy.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>The flu can trigger a heart attack, especially in older adults according to a study led by Dr. Jeff Kwong, a scientist at Public Health Ontario and the Institute for Clinical Evaluative Sciences.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Michelle Yee</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Photo Supplied</media:credit>
</media:content><media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/01/25/study-shows-the-flu-can-trigger-a-heart-attack-in-older-adults/womanhasheart_attack.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Study shows the flu can trigger a heart attack in older adults </media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/01/25/study-shows-the-flu-can-trigger-a-heart-attack-in-older-adults/womanhasheart_attack.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>The risk of heart attack in the days after a flu diagnosis increases six-fold, according to a new study in the New England Journal of Medicine.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Dreamstime</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Patients need more support to manage opioid prescription use, report states </title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/health_wellness/2018/01/25/patients-need-more-support-to-manage-opioid-prescription-use-report-states.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">ac145fe7-1bb2-4cbc-b009-5eabcd1c85f4</guid>
	<author>Megan Ogilvie - Health Reporter</author>
	<pubDate>Thu, 25 Jan 2018 06:00:00 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/01/25/patients-need-more-support-to-manage-opioid-prescription-use-report-states/dr_sheldon_fine.jpg"/><br/>Ontario doctors, surgeons and dentists are still prescribing opioids at too high a dose for too long a time to patients just starting the drug.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/01/25/patients-need-more-support-to-manage-opioid-prescription-use-report-states/dr_sheldon_fine.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Patients need more support to manage opioid prescription use, report states </media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/01/25/patients-need-more-support-to-manage-opioid-prescription-use-report-states/dr_sheldon_fine.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Dr. Sheldon Fine, a medical oncologist in Peel, was prescribed opioids after a 2017 surgical procedure. He was able to wean himself off the narcotics, with medical help, in the months after his surgery.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Carlos Osorio</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Toronto Star</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Life Without Plastic authors on how to reduce your plastic footprint</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/health_wellness/2018/01/22/life-without-plastic-authors-on-how-to-reduce-your-plastic-footprint.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">420ff2d9-6d4e-497a-a723-580583d8a4cc</guid>
	<author>Isabel Teotonio - Life Reporter</author>
	<pubDate>Mon, 22 Jan 2018 08:00:00 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/01/22/life-without-plastic-authors-on-how-to-reduce-your-plastic-footprint/bookauthors_edit_jpg.jpg"/><br/>Jay Sinha, co-author of Life Without Plastic, offers tips on how find alternatives to using plastic.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/01/22/life-without-plastic-authors-on-how-to-reduce-your-plastic-footprint/bookauthors_edit_jpg.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Life Without Plastic authors on how to reduce your plastic footprint</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/01/22/life-without-plastic-authors-on-how-to-reduce-your-plastic-footprint/bookauthors_edit_jpg.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Jay Sinha and Chantal Plamondon, the authors of "Life Without Plastic", share tips on how to avoid plastic use in your daily life.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Franziska Heinze</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Photo Supplied</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Practice hang time with this yoga pose</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/01/22/practice-hang-time-with-this-yoga-pose.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">368bf2bc-a88e-4515-9c94-180af9a89d09</guid>
	<author>YuMee Chung - Special to the Star</author>
	<pubDate>Mon, 22 Jan 2018 06:00:00 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/01/22/practice-hang-time-with-this-yoga-pose/hang_time.jpg"/><br/>Use this exercise to lighten up your landings and improve your relationship with gravity.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/01/22/practice-hang-time-with-this-yoga-pose/hang_time.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Practice hang time with this yoga pose</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/01/22/practice-hang-time-with-this-yoga-pose/hang_time.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>YuMee Chung demonstrates the gravity-defying Hang Time yoga pose.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Anne-Marie Jackson</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Toronto Star</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>If older parent becomes forgetful, here’s what you should know</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/health_wellness/opinion/2018/01/22/if-older-parent-becomes-forgetful-heres-what-you-should-know.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">aa9f8e40-4dae-4eec-8131-e1d31e1ba37c</guid>
	<author>Nira Rittenberg - Special to the Star</author>
	<pubDate>Mon, 22 Jan 2018 00:00:00 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/opinion/2018/01/22/if-older-parent-becomes-forgetful-heres-what-you-should-know/senior_memory_woes.jpg"/><br/>A person with Mild Cognitive Impairment, unlike a person with dementia, has no trouble with their usual activities of daily living.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/opinion/2018/01/22/if-older-parent-becomes-forgetful-heres-what-you-should-know/senior_memory_woes.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>If older parent becomes forgetful, here’s what you should know</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/opinion/2018/01/22/if-older-parent-becomes-forgetful-heres-what-you-should-know/senior_memory_woes.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Mild Cognitive Impairment (MCI) can cause an older person to become forgetful and lose  mental sharpness when handling paperwork or doing another household task.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner"></media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Three tips to increase productivity and help clear your mind</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/01/15/three-tips-to-increase-productivity-and-help-clear-your-mind.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">1c677703-6e44-42e6-8b69-65065bfa9c24</guid>
	<author>Neil Pasricha - Special to the Star</author>
	<pubDate>Mon, 15 Jan 2018 14:11:46 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/01/15/three-tips-to-increase-productivity-and-help-clear-your-mind/walking_at_work.jpg"/><br/>New research shows we’re using cellphones for more than four hours a day. That ain’t good, writes Neil Pasricha. </description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/01/15/three-tips-to-increase-productivity-and-help-clear-your-mind/walking_at_work.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Three tips to increase productivity and help clear your mind</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/01/15/three-tips-to-increase-productivity-and-help-clear-your-mind/walking_at_work.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>The average person walks five kilometres an hour, which means if you can take two meetings outside a day, you could be getting an extra 10 kilometres of exercise.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Dreamstime</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Province should fund psychotherapy by non-doctors, says provincial agency on health quality</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/health_wellness/2018/01/15/province-should-fund-psychotherapy-by-non-doctors-says-provincial-agency-on-health-quality.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">8330a754-e294-4a27-8d75-3dced1e1e2fa</guid>
	<author>Isabel Teotonio - Life Reporter</author>
	<pubDate>Mon, 15 Jan 2018 11:00:00 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/01/15/province-should-fund-psychotherapy-by-non-doctors-says-provincial-agency-on-health-quality/karen_fournier.jpg"/><br/>Ontario should consider funding psychotherapy delivered by non-doctors for people with depression and anxiety</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/01/15/province-should-fund-psychotherapy-by-non-doctors-says-provincial-agency-on-health-quality/karen_fournier.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Province should fund psychotherapy by non-doctors, says provincial agency on health quality</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/01/15/province-should-fund-psychotherapy-by-non-doctors-says-provincial-agency-on-health-quality/karen_fournier.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>CAMH social worker Karen Fournier, who runs CBT group sessions, says  psychotherapy can improve the mood of those with depression and anxiety.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Bernard Weil</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Toronto Star</media:credit>
</media:content><media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/01/15/province-should-fund-psychotherapy-by-non-doctors-says-provincial-agency-on-health-quality/front_emmanuel_lopez.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Province should fund psychotherapy by non-doctors, says provincial agency on health quality</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/2018/01/15/province-should-fund-psychotherapy-by-non-doctors-says-provincial-agency-on-health-quality/front_emmanuel_lopez.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Cognitive Behavioural Therapy group sessionshelped  Emmanuel Lopez. deal with his depression. Watching movies gives him solace and inspiration.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Vince Talotta</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Toronto Star</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Support your Half Moon Pose with props</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/01/15/support-your-half-moon-pose-with-props.html</link>

	<media:credit role="author">Anne-Marie Jackson</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Toronto Star</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Boost your immune system and ward off viruses with these foods</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/01/11/boost-your-immune-system-and-ward-off-viruses-with-these-foods.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">00f20c29-1d2a-48b4-9d2c-5af88a40cc5f</guid>
	<author>Rose Reisman - Special to the Star</author>
	<pubDate>Thu, 11 Jan 2018 17:00:00 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/01/11/boost-your-immune-system-and-ward-off-viruses-with-these-foods/chicken_soup_dreamstime.jpg"/><br/>Chicken soup helps, sure, but a diet rich in vegetables, fish and even garlic can help lessen the severity of a cold or prevent you from getting sick.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/01/11/boost-your-immune-system-and-ward-off-viruses-with-these-foods/chicken_soup_dreamstime.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Boost your immune system and ward off viruses with these foods</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/01/11/boost-your-immune-system-and-ward-off-viruses-with-these-foods/chicken_soup_dreamstime.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>The combination of chicken, homemade broth, veggies (such as carrots, celery and onions) and noodles or rice in chicken soup is immune-boosting and soothing, and the warm broth clears your nasal passages and keeps you hydrated.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Dreamstime</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Plank you very much, your core will welcome it: Yoga Moves</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/01/08/plank-you-very-much-your-core-will-welcome-it-yoga-moves.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">4aaa72a7-f4a9-4747-a5bc-da5112b56341</guid>
	<author>YuMee Chung - Special to the Star</author>
	<pubDate>Mon, 8 Jan 2018 06:00:00 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/01/08/plank-you-very-much-your-core-will-welcome-it-yoga-moves/ocho_plank.jpg"/><br/>The Ocho Plank has dancers draw a swirling figure-eight on the ground with their feet. It is great for improving core strength. </description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/01/08/plank-you-very-much-your-core-will-welcome-it-yoga-moves/ocho_plank.jpg" medium="image">

	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/health_wellness/advice/2018/01/08/plank-you-very-much-your-core-will-welcome-it-yoga-moves/ocho_plank.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>YuMee Chung demonstrates Ocho Plank in the Crystal Ballroom at the The Omni King Edward Hotel in Toronto.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Anne-Marie Jackson</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Toronto Star</media:credit>
</media:content>
